result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristan James Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tristan James Hanson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tristan James Hanson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Tristan James Hanson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs shall be collected by the Department of Correction as a condition of Extended Supervision and/or Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristan James Hanson

records.addlTxt:
3:27 PM 
Defendant Tristan James Hanson in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Tristan James Hanson.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" - Counts 1 & 2.
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves to dismiss - Counts 3 & 4.
So ordered.

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motion.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 2 Years
-Costs
-0 Jail (1) day credit

4:12 PM 
Defendant Tristan James Hanson in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Tristan James Hanson. 
Attorney Sauder informs the court this matter is resolved and moves for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 03:40 pm.

2:15 PM
Attorney Sauder moves to continue for further negotiations.
No objection.
Fax Transaction Report - Signed Signature Bond faxed to Dispatch
Scheduling conference on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:19 PM
 Defendant Tristan James Hanson in court with attorney Morgan Sauder. Prosecuting Atty Jenna L Gill appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Sauder and  Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint and waives formal reading.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Attorney Sauder informs the court her client wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: his right to preliminary hearing.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions counsel re: their clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over.


Court Orders:
-$2,000.00 Signature Bond
-No controlled substance or drug paraphernalia.

State files information.
Attorney Sauder waives formal reading.

Defendant enters plea of "NOT GUILTY" all counts.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
